data.title: Woman narrowly survives push from platform in front of approaching train
data.description: A man who pushed a woman in front of an approaching train at a Brussels metro station on Friday January 14 has been detained on suspicion of attempted manslaughter, according to prosecutors.

data.title: Sony shares tank over 12% after Microsoft and Activision's $68.7 billion tie-up plan
data.description: Investors fear Microsoft's planned acquisition of Activision will bring more competition to Sony's PlayStation and take away key games from Sony's platforms.

data.title: Dubai's virtual waiter startup sees a surge in demand during the Covid-19 pandemic
data.description: The Opaala platform, which allows customers to order and pay in restaurants through their smart phones, can also track the preferences of individual diners and create bespoke menus for them.

data.title: Amazon halts plan to stop accepting Visa credit cards in the UK
data.description: Amazon was expected to prevent Brits from using a Visa-issued credit card on its platform from Jan. 19.

data.title: Nigeria to lift Twitter ban after six-month suspension
data.description: Nigeria will lift its ban on Twitter from midnight on Thursday, the government said, a move that will give millions of people in Africa's most populous country access to the social media platform once again.
